com.apigee.flow.message
Interface MessageContext

public interface MessageContext

 Represents context for a message in execution.
 Provides getter/setter methods for request-message,response-message,flowinfo and flowvariables(variables).

getRequestMessage

Message getRequestMessage()
Returns:
the request message. The returned value can be used to access the protocol independent and protocol specific information of the request message

setRequestMessage

void setRequestMessage(Message message)

getResponseMessage

Message getResponseMessage()
Returns:
the response message, null if the message is in the request path. The returned value can be used to access the protocol independent and protocol specific information of the responseMessage message.

setResponseMessage

void setResponseMessage(Message message)

getErrorMessage

Message getErrorMessage()
Returns:
the error response message. The returned value can be used to set protocol independent and protocol specific information of the error message.

getMessage

Message getMessage()
Returns:
the request or response or the error message depending on the current state of the flow

getVariable

<T> T getVariable(java.lang.String name)
The flow may accumulate a lot of data during is life-cycle. The data can be accessed by "names". This method can be used to retrieve the flow data associated with the flow upto the point of invocation of this method.

Parameters:
name - the name of the flow variable
Returns:
returns the value of the flow variable

setVariable

boolean setVariable(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.Object value)
Set the value associated with a variable

Parameters:
name - the name of the variable
value - the new value for the variable
Returns:
true if the variable was updated, false if the variable is not updateable or if variable does not exist

removeVariable

boolean removeVariable(java.lang.String name)
Remove the variable from the context

Parameters:
name - the name of the variable
Returns:
true if the variable was removed, false if the variable is not removable or if variable does not exist

getFlowInfo

<T extends FlowInfo> T getFlowInfo(java.lang.String identifier)
Get the flow data that was previously added on to the flow.

Parameters:
identifier - the identifier of the flow data
Returns:
return the flow data instance associated with the flow
Throws:
java.lang.ClassCastException - if the object returned identified by the name is not the one being expected

addFlowInfo

boolean addFlowInfo(FlowInfo flowInfo)
Data can be added to the flow at any time during it life-cycle. The data can be any object that implements FlowInfo. Ensure that FlowInfo.getIdentifier() returns a unique string.

Parameters:
flowInfo - the flow data to associate with the flow

removeFlowInfo

void removeFlowInfo(java.lang.String identifier)
Parameters:
identifier - Identifier of the FlowInfo object to be removed

createMessage

Message createMessage(TransportMessage transportMessage)
